H0.text: Until the introduction of the euro, on 1 January 2002, which country had the schilling as its basic currency unit. Germany

H1.text: Until the introduction of the euro, on 1 January 2002, which country had the schilling as its basic currency unit. Switzerland

H2.text: Until the introduction of the euro, on 1 January 2002, which country had the schilling as its basic currency unit. Netherlands

H3.text: Until the introduction of the euro, on 1 January 2002, which country had the schilling as its basic currency unit. Ostria

A4.text: In 1925, the Austrian schilling was introduced, replacing the Krone at a rate of 10,000:1.
